title: Largest Net Trade Surplus
description: In 2023, China achieved a net trade surplus in goods amounting to $593.9 billion, the highest globally.

title: Highest Stock Market Turnover Ratio
description: China's stock market had a turnover ratio of 283.04% in 2022, indicating a high level of trading activity.

title: Largest Urban Population
description: By 2024, China had 451 million people living in urban agglomerations of more than 1 million, the largest in the world.

title: Largest Total Reserves
description: China's total reserves, including gold, reached $3.26 trillion in 2024, the highest globally.

title: Most Extensive Railway Goods Transport
description: In 2019, China's railways transported 3,018,200 million ton-km of goods, the highest globally.

title: Highest Liner Shipping Connectivity
description: In 2021, China scored 171.18 on the Liner Shipping Connectivity Index, the highest in the world.

title: Largest External Balance on Goods and Services
description: China's external balance on goods and services was $386 billion in 2023, the highest globally.

title: Highest Carbon Dioxide Damage Costs
description: In 2021, the cost of carbon dioxide damage in China was $482.5 billion, the highest globally.

title: Highest Particulate Emission Damage Costs
description: China incurred $83.8 billion in particulate emission damage costs in 2021, the highest worldwide.

title: Largest Gross Savings
description: In 2023, China's gross savings amounted to $7.76 trillion, the highest globally.

title: Highest Health Expenditure-Induced Poverty
description: In 2018, 28.61% of China's population was pushed below the poverty line due to out-of-pocket health expenses, the highest globally.

title: Lowest Net Primary Income
description: In 2023, China recorded a net primary income of -$148.24 billion, indicating a significant outflow of income to the rest of the world.

title: Minimal Net Errors and Omissions
description: China's net errors and omissions in 2023 amounted to -$37.93 billion, reflecting a relatively low level of unaccounted financial transactions.

title: Low Bilateral Aid from DAC Donors
description: In 2022, China received negative bilateral aid flows from several DAC donors, including Japan (-$606.23 million) and Italy (-$33.79 million).

title: Minimal Official Development Assistance Received
description: China received a net official development assistance of -$282.32 million in 2022, indicating a low level of aid received from international donors.

title: Lowest Population in Largest City
description: In 2024, only 3.24% of China's urban population resided in the largest city, showcasing a more even distribution of urban population.

title: Minimal Poverty Headcount Ratio
description: As of 2019, only 0.6% of China's population lived below the national poverty line, reflecting significant poverty reduction efforts.

title: Low International Migrant Stock
description: In 2015, international migrants constituted just 0.07% of China's population, indicating a low level of immigration.

title: Minimal Early Marriage Rate
description: In 2020, only 0.1% of women aged 20-24 in China were first married by age 15, highlighting progress in delaying early marriages.

title: Lowest Battle-Related Deaths
description: In 2023, China recorded only one battle-related death, indicating a period of relative peace and stability.
